intro: Justicia chrysotrichoma var. albiflora, commonly known as the silverleaf jewelweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pale yellow, often with a red or orange calyx. The plant has lance-shaped leaves covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near streams or in shaded areas. The flowers are typically borne in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
